title: Bob Marley tribute reggae festival in March 2026
byline: Sri Lanka will host South Asia’s first three-day reggae music festival, One Love 2026 – A Tribute to Bob Marley, from March 27 to 29, 2026, on the southern coastal town of Bentota.

title: Sri Lanka U19 Target Historic Upset Against Unbeaten India in Asia Cup Semi-Final
byline: Sri Lanka U19 will look to pull off a memorable upset when they face an unbeaten India U19 side in the first semi-final of the ACC Men’s U19 Asia Cup 2025 on Friday at the ICC Academy Ground, Dubai.

title: WADA names India worst doping offender for third straight year
byline: India tops the rankings of global sports drug cheats for a third straight year, the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) said, marking a dubious hat-trick for the country.

title: Former Olympic champion Dujardin continues dressage comeback after whipping ban
byline: Former Olympic dressage champion Charlotte Dujardin made her return to high-level competition in Britain on Thursday following the one-year ban over a horse-whipping controversy that led to her withdrawal from the Paris Games.

title: Deaths due to substandard medicine; NMRA faces legal action
byline: The Medical and Civil Rights Professional Association of Doctors (MCPA) had initiated legal action against the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA), raising serious concerns about patient safety, an official said.

title: Flood waste cleanup halfway complete, CEA says
byline: The Central Environmental Authority (CEA) has announced major progress in clearing waste generated by recent floods, signaling a positive step in post-disaster recovery efforts.

title: 119 being used for water, power complaints: Police warn over misuse of hotline
byline: Sri Lanka Police have raised concerns over the misuse of the 119 emergency hotline, which is dedicated to reporting crimes, emergencies, and urgent public safety information.

title: Historic Mihintale Vihare structures at risk due to heavy rains
byline: The Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) has warned that two structures at the historic Mihintale Viharaya are at risk of collapse and subsidence following recent heavy rains.

title: Market drifts lower amid cautious trade
byline: The CSE closed lower on Thursday, as the market traded sideways for most of the session amid subdued turnover and lower trading volumes. Investor sentiment remained cautious, with participants closely monitoring the economic impact of the recent cyclone and the pace of recovery across listed entities.

title: Mahamaya Girls’ College in Kandy closed indefinitely due to landslide risk
byline: Mahamaya Girls’ College in Kandy has been closed indefinitely following landslides in the area above the school caused by heavy rainfall.

title: Daily Mirror warns public of fake article circulating on social media
byline: An article currently being shared on social media platforms bearing the Daily Mirror logo is fake.

title: UN commends Sri Lanka’s disaster response efforts
byline: The Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd), met with the United Nations Resident Coordinator to Sri Lanka, Marc-André Franche, at the office of the Deputy Minister of Defence to review ongoing disaster response efforts, institutional reforms, and the coordination of international humanitarian assistance.

title: Mahindra India donates Rs. 100 million to Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund
byline: Mahindra India donated Rs. 100 million to the Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund this afternoon at the Ministry of Labour.

title: Flood alert issued for low-lying areas along Mahaweli River
byline: The Irrigation Department has warned of possible flood conditions in several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River during the next 48 hours due to rainfall received since last night in parts of the river’s catchment areas.

title: No compensation received by flood victims yet, Claims Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa, has alleged that despite assurances from the government, no compensation has so far been received by people affected by recent adverse weather conditions.

title: Three injured in Hunnasgiriya landslide
byline: The Disaster Management Center have issued warnings for drivers travelling on the Kandy-Mahiyanganaya road due to the risk of landslides following heavy rainfall in the mountainous areas of Ududumbara and Hunnasgiriya.

title: Schools in Central Province close till December 29
byline: All schools in the Central Province will remain closed from tomorrow (19) due to adverse weather conditions.

title: Kumara Rangahara 2025 of Mahinda College to be held on Saturday
byline: Kumara Rangahara 2025, a colourful variety concert showcasing the aesthetic talents of students of the Primary Section of Mahinda College, Galle, will be held on the 20th at 3:30 p.m. and 6:30 p.m. at the Auditorium of the Faculty of Medicine, Karapitiya.

title: Two Sri Lankan fishing boats captured in Maldivian waters
byline: The Maldivian Coast Guard on Wednesday captured two Sri Lankan fishing boats found within the Maldives’ Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

title: Possible opening of Moragahakanda Reservoir spill gates
byline: Authorities have warned of the potential opening of the spill gates at the Moragahakanda Reservoir due to rising water levels, following heavy rainfall and inflows from surrounding catchment areas.

title: Starlink supported SL to restore communication during the disaster: Deputy Minister
byline: Starlink supported Sri Lanka to restore its communication network which was broken down by Cyclone Ditwah, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne told Parliament today.

title: Executive Presidency will be abolished in new Constitution: PM assures
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya today assured that the Executive Presidency will be abolished as promised in the National People’s Power (NPP) manifesto.

title: US warns travellers to Sri Lanka over chikungunya
byline: The US Centre for Disease Control and Prevention has issued a Level 2 travel notice for Sri Lanka, advising travellers to “practice enhanced precautions.”

title: 73 children lose parents due to Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Seventy three children have lost their parents – one or both - due to disasters triggered by Cyclone Ditwah as reported by December 16.

title: 175,000 hectares of croplands destroyed, will there be a food security crisis?
byline: Of the country’s approximately 2.3 million hectares of agricultural land, 175,000 hectares or 7.6 percent of land has been damaged in Sri Lanka due to the recent cyclone causing a setback in harvest, output levels and driving price hikes for locally produced food, according to the Department of Agriculture compiled with the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).

title: Bondi Beach gunman originally from India, police say
byline: One of the two men suspected of carrying out a mass shooting at Bondi Beach was originally from southern India but had ’’limited contact’’ with his family there, police sources have said.

title: Over 90 drugs fail quality tests in 2025; majority from India
byline: A total of 93 drugs have failed quality tests so far in 2025, according to the Medical Supplies Division of the Health Ministry.

title: TikTok owner signs agreements to avoid US ban
byline: TikTok’s Chinese owner ByteDance has signed binding agreements with US and global investors for the majority of its business in America, TikTok’s boss told employees on Thursday.

title: Deputy Director of Colombo hospital suspended
byline: The Health and Mass Media Ministry has taken steps to suspend Dr. Rukshan Bellana, who served as the Deputy Director of the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Ex-Nascar driver and his family among seven killed in US plane crash
byline: A former Nascar driver and his family were among the seven people killed in a plane crash at a regional airport in North Carolina, the car-racing organisation has said.

title: Violence breaks out in Bangladesh after death of youth protest leader
byline: Violence has erupted in Bangladesh following the death of a prominent leader of the youth movement that ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Sri Lankan woman arrested at BIA for cigarette smuggling attempt
byline: A Sri Lankan woman has been arrested by Airport Customs officers at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a large consignment of foreign-made cigarettes into the country.

title: Tourism sector signals rapid recovery post-Ditwah; luxury segment sees strong momentum
byline: Sri Lanka’s hospitality sector is witnessing a swift return to normalcy following the passage of Cyclone Ditwah, with industry leaders confirming that operational disruptions were minimal and booking trends are

title: Rs. 25,000 paid to 257,000 affected families so far: Minister
byline: The initial grant of Rs. 25,000 paid for flood affected families to clean their houses have been paid to 257,000 families out of the total of 493,000 entiled to the payment so far, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said today.

title: Trump suspends US green card lottery in wake of Brown University and MIT shootings
byline: The homeland security secretary, Kristi Noem, has ordered the suspension of the green card lottery program at Donald Trump’s direction, saying it allowed the suspect in the Brown University and MIT shootings to come to the US.

title: NPP MP blames police, Opposition for spreading falsehood
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP Shantha Pathmakumara today accused the police and the Opposition of spreading falsehoods about him and thus violating his parliamentary privileges.

title: New Zealand Cricket chief quits after split over new T20 league
byline: The boss of New Zealand cricket resigned on Friday after a long and bitter dispute with players and member associations over the future of T20 cricket in the country.

title: Australia’s ’Bondi Hero’ handed $1.65 mln collected from fundraising
byline: A man credited with saving lives for wrestling a gun from one of the alleged attackers during a mass shooting at Australia’s Bondi Beach received a cheque for more than A$2.5 million ($1.65 million) on Friday, after tens of thousands of people contributed to a donation website.

title: Mahaweli water level rises in Manampitiya
byline: The water level in the Manampitiya area of the Mahaweli River basin has risen above the minor flood level due to heavy rainfall, according to Irrigation Director (Hydrology and Disaster Management) Engineer L.S. Sooriyabandara.

title: GovPay surpasses Rs. 2 billion in transactions
byline: GovPay, Sri Lanka’s government digital payment platform, surpassed Rs. 2 billion in total transaction value, the Ministry of Digital Economy said.

title: Moragahakanda Reservoir to release water tonight
byline: Authorities have issued a warning to residents living along the Amban River as the Moragahakanda Reservoir is set to release water tonight.

title: Dasun Shanaka to lead Sri Lanka until 2026 T20 World Cup
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket’s newly appointed Selection Committee Chairman, Pramodya Wickremesinghe said today (19) that Dasun Shanaka will continue as captain of the Sri Lankan national team until the 2026 ICC Twenty20 World Cup.

title: Court clears release of 166 more BYD vehicles
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) to release a further 166 BYD vehicles detained by Customs, subject to the furnishing of the relevant bank guarantees and corporate guarantees.

title: Chelsea’s Maresca says Man City link '100 percent' speculation
byline: Enzo Maresca said Friday that reports linking him to the Manchester City manager’s job were ’’100 percent’’ speculation, promising that he would still be at Chelsea next season.

title: WECare vaccinates more than 32,000 dogs , expands aid after flood
byline: In the aftermath of the devastating floods, while many organisations rushed to assist affected communities, one group turned its attention to often-overlooked victims — street dogs.

title: Bellana was removed for revealing sensitive info on patients: Deputy Minister
byline: National Hospital Deputy Director Dr. Rukshan Bellana was removed from his post as he had revealed sensitive information on patients and creating panic, Deputy Minister of Health Hansaka Wijemuni told Parliament today.

title: Julian Assange files complaint against Nobel Foundation over Machado prize
byline: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has filed a criminal complaint in Sweden against the Nobel Foundation, challenging the organisation’s decision to award its Peace Prize to Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado.

title: Train services to resume on upcountry and eastern lines from tomorrow
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Department has announced the resumption of new train services on the Upcountry and Eastern Railway lines, effective from tomorrow (20), aimed at improving passenger convenience.

title: President to attend Parliament for debate on Rs. 500 bn
byline: President and Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to attend Parliament today (19) to participate in the debate on a supplementary estimate of Rs. 500 billion.

title: BASL condemns Kaduwela Mayor’s conduct over obstruction of lawyer
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has strongly condemned the conduct of Kaduwela Mayor Ranjan Jayalal, alleging that he had obstructed and hindered an Attorney-at-Law while representing an Animal Welfare Association at an inquiry conducted by the Mayor.

title: Donations to ’Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund’ surpass Rs. 4 bn
byline: The total donations received by the ’Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund’ has increased up to Rs. 4.2 billion as of today, Secretary to the Ministry of Finance Harshana Suriyapperuma said today.

title: Former leaders’ support will not be sought in fund raising due to their corrupt practices: PM
byline: The government will not seek the support of former leaders who were involved in corruption through disasters, in the fund raising process this time, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today.

title: Minister orders urgent reforms at Werahera motor traffic office
byline: The Transport, Highways and Urban DevelopmentMinister Bimal Ratnayake, has directed a series of urgent administrative and service reforms following an inspection tour of the Werahera office of the Department of Motor Traffic today (18).

title: Flood warning extended for low-lying areas in Mahaweli river basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has extended the flood warning for several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River Basin for a further 24 hours.

title: Australia announces gun buyback plans
byline: Australia will use a sweeping buyback scheme to ’’get guns off our streets,’’ Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Friday, showing his government was keen to take quick action less than a week after a terrorist attack left 15 people dead at a Jewish holiday gathering on Sydney’s famed Bondi Beach.

title: Rs. 500Bn Supplementary Estimate approved in Parliament
byline: The Supplementary Estimate of Rs. 500 billion to restore the livelihoods of those affected by the sudden disaster situation, was approved by Parliament today (19).

title: President hits at inflation risks as Rs. 500 bn cyclone rebuilding begins
byline: The government faces the challenge of preventing a surge in inflation as the Rs. 500 billion allocated for rebuilding the country after Cyclone Ditwah begins to circulate in the economy, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: Market extends pullback
byline: The CSE extended its downward trend on Friday, marking another red session amid subdued turnover and lower trading volumes. Investor sentiment remained weak as the market continued to pull back from its All-Time High (ATH), with the ASPI now reflecting a 9.3% correction from peak levels.

title: Medical lab raided over patient safety violations
byline: Blood collection tubes meant for single use were washed and reused on several patients at a private medical laboratory in Laggala leading to a raid by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA).

title: President arrives in Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in the Parliament chamber a short while ago and has begun his address to Parliament.

title: Only red rice and gravy in members’ canteen in Parliament: Archchuna
byline: Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna today created a commotion in Parliament, protesting the non-availability of food in the members’ canteen when he went for lunch.

title: Brown University shooting suspect found dead, police say
byline: The suspect ‍in ​last week’s ‌mass shooting at Brown University has been found dead in a storage facility in Salem, New Hampshire, following a six-day multi-state manhunt, police say.

title: OCC clears proposed settlement for SriLankan Airlines borrowings
byline: The Official Creditor Committee (OCC) has formally granted a “no objection” clearance, enabling Sri Lanka to proceed with its proposed settlement arrangements for foreign borrowings guaranteed by the government for SriLankan Airlines.

title: Water supply to be disrupted in several areas in Colombo
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced an eight-hour water supply interruption on Saturday, 20 December 2025, from 8.30 a.m. to 4.30 p.m.

title: IMF approves US$206 Mn emergency financing for Sri Lanka after Ditwah
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a disbursement of SDR 150.5 million, equivalent to about US$206 million, for Sri Lanka under the Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI).

title: No alcohol found in Ashoka Ranwala’s blood, urine samples
byline: No traces of alcohol were detected in the blood and urine samples obtained from former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Parliamentarian Ashoka Ranwala, according to tests conducted by the Government Analyst’s Department.
